snippet: The post-Arab Spring rise of Islamist leaders appeared to bypass Libya, where a coalition led by a Western-educated political scientist led the early vote count.
abstract: Preliminary election results in Libya show that a coalition led by Mahmoud Jibril, a Western-educated political scientist appears to be beating its Islamist rivals; apparent success of Jibril’s party over the Muslim Brotherhood’s bloc makes him perhaps the most important voice in the next stage of Libya’s transition, though he is barred for now from elected office; both Islamists and their opponents say that the coalition is headed for at least a plurality of the planned congress, which is expected to govern Libya for 18 months.
lead_paragraph: The post-Arab Spring rise of Islamist leaders appeared to bypass Libya, where a coalition led by a Western-educated political scientist led the early vote count.

headline.seo: Coalition Led by Pro-Western Official Claims Lead in Libya
headline.main: Election Results in Libya Break an Islamist Wave
headline.print_headline: Libya Results Seen to Break Islamist Wave

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
